SQL

Class SQL

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQL.SQL

  • public class SQL
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to connect to a database, create taskspecific tables and insert data to those
    Author:
    finn

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static boolean connect(java.lang.String hostname,
                              int port,
                              java.lang.String dbname,
                              java.lang.String user,
                              java.lang.String password)
        Used to connect to a database-server.
        Parameters:
        hostname - The ip of the DB-Server to connect to. Might be "localhost".
        port - The port, the DB-Server runs on. Typically 3306 for MySQL and probably MariaDB.
        dbname - The name of the database on which queries should run. In this case "data".
        user - The username of the DB-Server. Standard is "root".
        password - The password of the user. Standard is "".
        Returns:
        Boolean to indicate error (false) or success (true).

      • disconnect

        public static boolean disconnect()
        Used to disconnect from the database-server.
        Returns:
        Boolean to indicate error (false) or success (true).

      • init

        public static boolean init()
        Init/Reset all three tables. Deletes all previously saved data.

      • setErrorReporting

        public static void setErrorReporting(int state)
        Set what to do if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        state - Integer. Either SQL.ERROR_EXIT or SQL.ERROR_PRINT or SQL.ERROR_NONE
